recommendations.body: **Booster shots** [offer necessary protection](https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#covidnet-hospitalizations-vaccination) against infection, serious illness and death from all COVID variants, and are [90% effective at preventing hospitalization](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm7104e3.htm?s_cid=mm7104e3_x) from Omicron.
**Vaccinations** for children 5 and up can protect against infection, serious illness and death from COVID.
**Testing frequently** is important for reducing spread. Rapid testing prior to in-person gatherings can help reduce risk of infection and protect vulnerable individuals.

**Masks** are recommended for vaccinated and boosted individuals in public indoor spaces. Unvaccinated people should mask in all public spaces. The [most effective masks](https://www.nytimes.com/article/covid-masks.html) are N95, KN95, KF94 and surgical masks.
